snippet: A recently published study suggests that vehicle bloat removes the luster from any advances in efficiency-boosting technology.
abstract: A recently published study suggests that vehicle bloat removes the luster from any advances in efficiency-boosting technology.
lead_paragraph: That cars have put on weight and added horsepower should be no great surprise to even casual observers of the auto industry. But a report by an economics professor at M.I.T. tries to quantify to what degree vehicle bloat has impacted the fuel economy that might have been.

headline.main: M.I.T. Professor: High Weight and Horsepower Nullify Gains in Efficiency
